Class Grid

java.lang.Object
Grid
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Class representing a Reversi board grid
Version:
1.0
Author:
Kai Uerlichs
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.lang.String[] LETTER_REFERENCE
    This is used across the project to correctly understand alphanumeric codes for fields on the grid

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Grid()
    Constructor initialising the standard Reversi grid of (8x8)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean checkMoveValid​(int x, int y, int colour)
    Check whether a certain move is valid to play
    boolean checkValidMoves()
    Check if any valid moves can be played by either player
    boolean checkValidMoves​(int colour)
    Check if any valid moves can be played by a player of the specified colour
    void display()
    Displays the grid to the console, where (X) represents light pieces and (O) represents dark pieces.
    void display​(int colour)
    Displays the grid with hints to the console, where (X) represents light pieces and (O) represents dark pieces.
    int getMoveScore​(int x, int y, int colour)
    Return a score for each move (how many new pieces in specified colour will be generated?)
    int[] getResults()
    Determine the current results of the game
    int getSizeX()  
    int getSizeY()  
    void initialiseOthello()
    This method initialises the grid in Othello mode, meaning the centre four pieces will be filled in accordance to the Othello rule set
    boolean isEmpty​(int x, int y)
    Checks whether a field on the Reversi grid is currently empty (0)
    void makeMove​(int x, int y, int colour)
    Makes a move on the grid, if valid
    void placePiece​(int x, int y, int colour)
    Places a piece on the Reversi board without abiding to the usual move rules

    void setSizeY​(int sizeY)

    • LETTER_REFERENCE

      public static final java.lang.String[] LETTER_REFERENCE
      This is used across the project to correctly understand alphanumeric codes for fields on the grid

  • Constructor Details

    • Grid

      public Grid()
      Constructor initialising the standard Reversi grid of (8x8)

  • Method Details

    • initialiseOthello

      public void initialiseOthello()
      This method initialises the grid in Othello mode, meaning the centre four pieces will be filled in accordance to the Othello rule set
      See Also:
      Wikipedia page on Reversi/Othello

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty​(int x, int y)
      Checks whether a field on the Reversi grid is currently empty (0)
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      Returns:
      Whether the field is empty (true) or not (false)

    • placePiece

      public void placePiece​(int x, int y, int colour)
      Places a piece on the Reversi board without abiding to the usual move rules
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      colour - The colour to set

    • display

      public void display()
      Displays the grid to the console, where (X) represents light pieces and (O) represents dark pieces.

    • display

      public void display​(int colour)
      Displays the grid with hints to the console, where (X) represents light pieces and (O) represents dark pieces.
      Parameters:
      colour - The colour to evaluate for hints

    • checkMoveValid

      public boolean checkMoveValid​(int x, int y, int colour)
      Check whether a certain move is valid to play
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      colour - The colour to play
      Returns:
      Whether the move is valid
      See Also:
      Wikipedia page on game rules

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove​(int x, int y, int colour)
      Makes a move on the grid, if valid
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      colour - The colour of the move

    • checkValidMoves

      public boolean checkValidMoves()
      Check if any valid moves can be played by either player
      Returns:
      Whether any valid moves are possible

    • checkValidMoves

      public boolean checkValidMoves​(int colour)
      Check if any valid moves can be played by a player of the specified colour
      Parameters:
      colour - The colour to check moves for
      Returns:
      Whether any valid moves are possible

    • getMoveScore

      public int getMoveScore​(int x, int y, int colour)
      Return a score for each move (how many new pieces in specified colour will be generated?)
      Parameters:
      x - The x coordinate
      y - The y coordinate
      colour - The colour of the move
      Returns:
      The score

    • getResults

      public int[] getResults()
      Determine the current results of the game
      Returns:
      An integer array containing the results (winner/current leader, light pieces, dark pieces)
